title: The effect of polarity and hydrogen bonding on the electronic and vibrational structure of the salicylate anion in acetonitrile and water: implicit and explicit solvation approaches
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,29569-29587
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA04606D, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Siddharth Mall Bishen, Meena Adhikari, Sandeep Pokharia, Hirdyesh Mishra
This study uses computational models to explore how solvent polarity and hydrogen bonding affect sodium salicylate anion in acetonitrile and water to investigate their impact on enol–keto stabilization and ESIPT fluorescence quenching.
